description: Oral contract between merchants with written confirmation
facts: Quinn and Rachel are both merchants in the electronics business
They orally agreed on a sale of 500 laptops for $300,000
Quinn sent a written confirmation within 10 days
Rachel received the confirmation but did not object within 10 days
asp_facts: contract(c9). subject_matter(c9, goods). parties(c9, quinn, rachel). both_merchants(c9, yes). sale_amount(c9, 300000). oral_agreement(c9, yes). written_confirmation_sent(c9, yes). confirmation_timely(c9, yes). no_objection(c9, yes).
question: Is this contract enforceable under the Statute of Frauds?
rationale: Under UCC 2-201(2), between merchants, if one party sends written confirmation and the other does not object within 10 days, the contract satisfies the Statute of Frauds even though it was originally oral.
